## Proposal
[Updated](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/30921#issuecomment-1795769911)

- Recognized that the `ExceededCommentLength` component was connected to Onyx for performance reasons
- Changed recommendation to have consumers pass in the onyx key for the comment draft rather than hardcoding the key
- Allows minimal change, no new components need to be created
- Allows flexibility as new consumers can specify the key without needing to update logic in `ExceededCommentLength`.

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
No error message and could not send the message

### What is the root cause of that problem?
We're passing `reportID` here as a param of `ExceededCommentLength`, and we're connecting to the report comment in `ExceededCommentLength`, so it will always yield the wrong (empty) draft because the `ExceededCommentLength` in message edit is supposed to get the report action comment draft instead.

Earlier `ExceededCommentLength` was refactored to that it would contain within itself the logic to fetch report comment, for performance purpose, but we didn't do the same in the message edit case, we still use the `comment` prop for message edit.

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
<!-- DO NOT POST CODE DIFFS -->
We should remove `comment` prop, accept another optional prop `reportActionID` in `ExceededCommentLength`, and in [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7601f89c6a1623cc1b68785720db8d1172b66315/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js#L64), if both `reportActionID` and `reportID` exists, we'll retrieve the comment from `REPORT_ACTIONS_DRAFTS` by `reportActionID` and `reportID` instead.

That will make sure the `ExceededCommentLength` works well for both main composer and edit composer, and it will also improve the performance by reduce the unnecessary re-rendering of `ExceededCommentLength` in edit composer (similar to what we achieved when moving the Onyx call inside `ExceededCommentLength` earlier by introducing the `reportID` prop).

**Detail Implementation:**

1. Use reportActionID instead of comment [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7601f89c6a1623cc1b68785720db8d1172b66315/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItemMessageEdit.js#L465) 

 `reportActionID={props.action.reportActionID}`

2. Change the key [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7601f89c6a1623cc1b68785720db8d1172b66315/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js#L65) based on reportActionID and reportID
 
```
        key: ({reportID, reportActionID}) => reportActionID && reportID? `${ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_ACTIONS_DRAFTS}${reportID}`:`${ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_DRAFT_COMMENT}${reportID}`,
```

3. Get the comment from props

```
    const comment = props.reportActionID && props.reportID? get(props,['comment', props.reportActionID],''): get(props, 'comment','')
```

4. Change [props.comment](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/7601f89c6a1623cc1b68785720db8d1172b66315/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js#L41-L43) to `comment` (the one we get above)


### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
NA

## Proposal 
     
### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
- No error message when editing a chat to go past character limit

### What is the root cause of that problem?
- [ExceededCommentLength](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js) uses the ```comment``` prop to decide if it will display error or not (when ```comment.length``` > 10K, it will display error). This ```comment``` is from ```ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_DRAFT_COMMENT```
- And [ExceededCommentLength](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js) uses in [ReportActionItemMessageEdit](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItemMessageEdit.js) as well, so when the main composer has < 10K characters, edit composer has > 10K characters, the edit composer will have no error. 
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
- Rather than getting the ```comment``` from ```ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_DRAFT_COMMENT```, we can just pass the ```comment``` param to ```ExceededCommentLength``` from its parent component. This can fix this issue, also reducing the delay time in updating max length error (currently, when user types more than 10K, it will delay 1500ms before displaying error).
- We can do it by these below steps:
1. Remove subscribing ```ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.REPORT_DRAFT_COMMENT```
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/2c7062b917a2d31b709691166633f171dd1fce8c/src/components/ExceededCommentLength.js#L63-L68
2. With ```ReportActionItemMessageEdit```, we do not need to do anything because we already had the below logic:
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/2c7062b917a2d31b709691166633f171dd1fce8c/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionItemMessageEdit.js#L468
3. With ```ReportActionComposer```, updating
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/358c3bf4fd161c51cf4ea00110576af3afe03ce9/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionCompose/ReportActionCompose.js#L454
to
```
<ExceededCommentLength comment={value} ... />                 
```
with ```value``` from:
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/347df0cc6bc9c1af6a0c7d6ed4034e4222fbf37e/src/pages/home/report/ReportActionCompose/ComposerWithSuggestions.js#L112
### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
- To reduce the number of re-render times of component ```ExceededCommentLength```:  Rather than passing the ```comment``` param to ```ExceededCommentLength``` from its parent component like the above solution, we can just pass the param called ```isExceedMaxLength``` to ```ExceededCommentLength``` from its parent component. So the ```ExceededCommentLength``` just re-renders when the ```isExceedMaxLength``` update its value from true to false and Vice versa

@DylanDylann So, your solution actually rolls back the changes introduced in this performance PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/25758 - are you sure it actually improves the performance?

@burczu  
- Before, we need to display exactly the current input length, for example 12000/10000, so we need to get the comment from Onyx - that will be updated with 1000ms delay to increase the performance. If we do not get the comment from Onyx, the ```ExceededCommentLength``` will re-render once the input change, affect to the performace.

- But now, we just need to know whether the input is greater than the MAX_COMMENT_LENGTH or not, so my proposal suggested that, we just need to pass the ```isExceedMaxLength``` to ```ExceededCommentLength``` from its parent. So the ```ExceededCommentLength``` just re-render once the ```isExceedMaxLength``` update from "true" to "false" or vice versa. 

-  Besides fixing this bug, it also reduce the delay time when updating the error (Currently, updating error has 1500ms delay)

The 1500ms delay is an intentional debounce, the current setup avoids the component fetching the comment directly to keep evaluation out of the render. Sidestepping this will decrease performance unless you move the debounce into each consumer of `ExceededCommentLength`, which is why #25758 centralized the comment length check.

@burczu

I think the number of re-render times in my solution is less than the @erquhart `s solution because with my solution, it just re-render if the ```isExceedMaxLength``` changes. Meanwhile, the another one will render once the input changes. Please correct me once you have a chance.

So the ExceededCommentLength just re-render once the isExceedMaxLength update from "true" to "false" or vice versa.

@DylanDylann By agreeing with @erquhart I meant that just passing `isExceedMaxLength` to the `ExceededCommentLength` component will force us to move debouncing to the parent components to keep the performance, so I don't think it's best solution here.
@burczu any opinion on my proposal 😄?

@bernhardoj Ah, yes - it looks like some kind of workaround for me - I think taking the comment from correct Onyx key for creating and editing seems to be more consistent than taking it from Onyx in one case and from props in another.
Let's now wait for @tgolen opinion because I'm curious what he thinks.

While waiting for @tgolen, I just want to clarify a bit of my proposal. The idea of my proposal is to free `ExceededCommentLength` component from Onyx dependency. It just takes a `comment` props without needing to know where the comment comes from. So, we create a wrapper for the main composer whose job is to retrieve the draft from the Onyx. We can do the same for the edit composer to make it consistent I guess.

@burczu needing to also pass the report action id with my proposal is an implementation detail, I'm hoping code in my proposal is treated as pseudo code. The approach in my proposal still works, and is still the best to maintain existing performance improvements for the `ExceededCommentLength` component. Wasn't meant to be a true diff as guidelines specify not to provide diffs in our proposals.

Again, proposals saying we should disconnect from Onyx will reverse the paid work in #25758.

All right, coming in with fresh eyes, I see we have multiple proposals here. Every time I've come across a similar problem (one component needing a piece of data that could exist in two different collections like a draft collection and a regular collection), the best solution I've always found is to lift up the onyx connection to the parents. I think this is the most simple, cleanest, most straightforward solution.

The only argument I hear against that is that it would undo a change that was made for performance. That's good to know, but it doesn't need to be a blocker for the solution. As long as the solution does not degrade performance, then that's really all that matters.

I think the RCA from @DylanDylann was the most comprehensive and easiest for me to understand and I think both the main solution (only pass down `comment`) or the alternate solution (have a prop for `isExceedMaxLength`) is acceptable as long as you are able to prove that there is no performance decrease. I am leaning more toward `isExceedMaxLength` or maybe call it something like `shouldDisplayError`. Also, I'd love to get rid of the debounce. As I understand, the performance problem isn't in checking the length of the comment, but rather in the re-rendering of the component.

@DylanDylann can you please show evidence that your solution won't lead to a performance regression, and then I think the job is yours.
